data.title: Stoke Mandeville Stadium
data.meta_description: We pride ourselves on helping the community, we have various drop in sessions, referral schemes and classes that could help you or someone you know.
data.text:
Walking Football

Every Monday 11am to 12pm

Over 18’s

£5.05 Per Session

Walking football at Stoke Mandeville Stadium is a fun, friendly and safe way of engaging in physical activity for both men and women. Its open to everyone whether you've played football before or not. Its great for the mind as well as the body and is a sociable sport giving everyone involved a chance to make new friends and enjoy being part of a team

Walking Netball

Every Wednesday 12pm to 1pm

Over 16’s

£6 Per Session

Walking Netball at Stoke Mandeville Stadium run by England Netball is a fun, friendly and safe way of engaging in physical activity for both men and women. Its open to everyone whether you've played netball before or not. Its great for the mind as well as the body and is a sociable sport giving everyone involved a chance to make new friends and enjoy being part of a team.

Thursday Night Football

Every Thursday 8pm to 9pm

Over 18’s

£5 Per Session

Thursday Night Football at Stoke Mandeville Stadium is a fun, friendly and safe way of engaging in physical activity for both men and women. Its open to everyone whether you've played football before or not. Its great for the mind as well as the body and is a sociable sport giving everyone involved a chance to make new friends and enjoy being part of a team.

No Strings Badminton

Every Tuesday 8pm to 10pm

£5.85 For Adults

£3.92 For Juniors 16 & Under

No Strings Badminton (NSB) is a national participation programme offering low-cost, fun ‘pay and play sessions’ at a venue near you. Providing participants with a friendly and welcoming environment to play badminton, socialise and keep fit on their terms, NSB is fully inclusive and open to adult players of any age or ability.

Aces Wheelchair Basketball

Every Friday – 6pm to 8pm Juniors & 8pm to 10pm Seniors

4 Sessions Free

Aces cater for all ages and abilities through specifically tailored club training sessions and games via British Wheelchair Basketball’s Junior League and National League competitions. We currently run three teams across the British Wheelchair Basketball National League pyramid. We have a team currently playing in Division 1 South, Division 2 South and a Junior League team for our 13-18 year olds.
